title: Real Madrid 'could make more deals with Mino Raiola' after signing goalkeeper Alphonse Areola
text:
Real Madrid could be set to do more business with super agent Mino Raiola after signing Alphonse Areola from PSG in the summer transfer window.

Areola is one of a multitude of high-profile players on Raiola's books, though the agent has been criticised by clubs for demanding sky-high fees for his services.

But, according to Marca, Madrid are open to doing more business with Raiola and that could open the door to a move for Manchester United's Paul Pogba.

Real Madrid's relationship with Mino Raiola could help them to sign Paul Pogba from Man Utd

Paul Pogba revealed he wanted to leave Manchester United at the end of last season

Pogba is Raiola's biggest name client and was top of Madrid's transfer list in the summer transfer window, but a deal failed to materialise.

However, Marca have reported that they haven't given up on signing the France midfielder and believe a smooth relationship with Raiola will boost their chances of securing his signature.

Pogba has spoken of his desire to leave United and embark on a new challenge after a disappointing three-year spell at Old Trafford, which has been blighted by inconsistent form and United's struggles on the pitch.

However, the former Juventus man still has another two years on his current deal, with the option of a further year which United can activate in 2021.
description: Real Madrid could be set to do more business with super agent Mino Raiola after signing Alphonse Areola from PSG  in the summer transfer window.
